title: Police Report for Trespassing, theft or other crimes of local2u or its employees

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the West Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello,

Please consider this a records request under WV §29B-1.

We seek records related to any police reports involving he company local2u, and its principals (Troy Snyder, formerly Lance Ware), employees for trespassing, theft, or other criminal activity related to private property in Kanawha County. Including, but not limited to a radio tower off of Nease Drive.

Regards,

Julie Harney

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Julie H

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: FLHSMV records re: license change
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

- all communications to or from executive director Dave Kerner between Dec. 20, 2024 and Jan. 8, 2025 containing the key terms "James Rose" or "trans".

- all communications to or from executive director Dave Kerner and staff of the Executive Office of the Governor between Dec. 20, 2024 and Jan. 8, 2025. This includes any emails from the domain "@eog.myflorida.com" or personal email accounts of executive office staff used for government business.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

CJ Ciaramella

communications.subject: HSMV Public Records Request Ref No :: P819863-010825
communications.communication:
Dear CJ Ciaramella, Thank you for contacting the Florida Department of Highway Safety and Motor Vehicles. In accordance with § 119.07(1)(c), Fla. Stat., receipt of your public records request is hereby acknowledged. You substantially seek the following records: "Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:
- all communications to or from executive director Dave Kerner between Dec. 20, 2024 and Jan. 8, 2025 containing the key terms "James Rose" or "trans".
- all communications to or from executive director Dave Kerner and staff of the Executive Office of the Governor between Dec. 20, 2024 and Jan. 8, 2025. This includes any emails from the domain "@eog.myflorida.com" or personal email accounts of executive office staff used for government business.
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.." Your public records request has been assigned Ref. # P819863-010825 for tracking purposes and been referred to the Office Of General Counsel for processing. Respectfully yours, Molly Best Communications Office DEPARTMENT OF HIGHWAY SAFETY AND MOTOR VEHICLES 
 DRIVER LICENSE AND MOTOR VEHICLE RECORDS: Records requests are processed without delay; however, due to high volume of requests received in Bureau of Records, please allow two weeks' processing time from date of this message.

communications.subject: RE: [EXT] Florida Sunshine Law Request: FLHSMV records re: license change
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

Your request has been entered into our public records portal and assigned reference number P819863-010825. If records consistent with your request are identified the public records section will be in contact.

Thanks,

Molly Best
Director of Communications
Florida Department of Highway Safety and Motor Vehicles
(o)  850-617-2373
(m) 850-294-3540

title: FOIA Request: OPW 54338 Omaha Streetcar Vehicle Procurement

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request access to the following records related to the most recent streetcar procurement by the Omaha Streetcar Authority:
Complete Submissions from Competitors: This includes all proposals, bids, and submissions from competing firms, detailing pricing, technical specifications, project timelines, and any other relevant information provided during the procurement process.
Evaluation Documents: Any documents related to the evaluation of the submissions, including scoring sheets, evaluation criteria, and notes from evaluators.
Communications: All communications between the Omaha Streetcar Authority and the competing firms, including emails, letters, meeting minutes, and any other forms of correspondence.
Contracts and Agreements: Copies of any contracts, agreements, or memorandums of understanding signed with the selected firm.
Meeting Minutes and Reports: Minutes from meetings where the procurement was discussed, as well as any reports or presentations related to the procurement process.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Margaret Wardell
